intro: Calonyction dubium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, upright stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Calonyction dubium prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often growing in rocky or gravelly habitats. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
